title: got USELESS_PEER for regular GET_BLOCKS requests
body:
I get a lot of that, from different go peers, 
and have hard time to find peers to download
blocks, maybe there is way for improvement ? 

```
17:15:25 [net]  To:     static.100.73.76.144.clients.your-server.de/144.76.73.100:30303     Send:   [GET_BLOCKS d1f16caf19d667e31dae28121057a7ded34a4af954e2dc21ca9ba707a75d2585...6f3cf29343f6682f4c773ec25ab90ac245323d1b285e3d8331d2a0c90509e18c] (100)
17:15:25 [net]  From:   static.100.73.76.144.clients.your-server.de/144.76.73.100:30303     Recv:   [DISCONNECT reason=USELESS_PEER]
```
Please provide a log with more context.

@fjl : not much to provide the handshake goes well
also the HELLO and the STATUS exchange but , while
trying to ask for blocks getting that disconnect , and it 
goes over and over again with different peers but always
go impl.
It would still be useful to know the values exchange during HELLO and STATUS.

```
17:01:42 [net]  To:     81.89.51.157.vnet.sk/81.89.51.157:30303     Send:   [HELLO p2pVersion=4 clientId=Ethereum(J)/v0.9.5/Dev/Windows/Java capabilities=[eth:60] peerPort=30303 peerId=45ad066fe56e48c0496280a06e722116342d5e34adb3936edb6de3f57a9b5db654f7bfefa7762963257c6c367d7819cefecff0b56a7ec6cc32d121254c8dc379]
17:01:46 [net]  From:   81.89.51.157.vnet.sk/81.89.51.157:30303     Recv:   [HELLO p2pVersion=4 clientId=Geth/v0.9.38/windows/go1.4.2 capabilities=[eth:61 eth:60] peerPort=0 peerId=8c5cc1331e3e40319415a77e0d2b64d06db3a5d1e5e28eba2a92b40c651864370e31b5f7596678488d66c30575df7ff3d046f5866b7256e870777fae0afbf19f]

17:01:46 [net]  From:   81.89.51.157.vnet.sk/81.89.51.157:30303     Recv:   [STATUS protocolVersion=60 networkId=0 totalDifficulty=0b6ed2d7c9ffd8 bestHash=e391af9b1dec17bf83e89ee94ae662f613facbe2046799089a57dacc8d959fa8 genesisHash=fd4af92a79c7fc2fd8bf0d342f2e832e1d4f485c85b9152d2039e03bc604fdca]
17:01:46 [net]  To:     81.89.51.157.vnet.sk/81.89.51.157:30303     Send:   [STATUS protocolVersion=60 networkId=0 totalDifficulty=2b8e6c2a bestHash=5e7346da4e6855f2a01f4dd38b5cd8850212806736c3ebe8b3ee9e195ff76048 genesisHash=fd4af92a79c7fc2fd8bf0d342f2e832e1d4f485c85b9152d2039e03bc604fdca]

17:01:47 [net]  To:     81.89.51.157.vnet.sk/81.89.51.157:30303     Send:   [GET_BLOCKS 24c89f8c49828639b73566d71b1178a61a75f14cb36dccba0e180ca45ea41f0a...b12ec400aa979c650fca817f01ad7f727f5c165428751fa6d3eb3cbd87332066] (100)

17:01:49 [net]  From:   81.89.51.157.vnet.sk/81.89.51.157:30303     Recv:   [DISCONNECT reason=USELESS_PEER]

```

That is from my try 1h ago 
the other are pretty similar
@fjl: Felix, any thoughts ?
Thinking.
:thought_balloon:

Are you sure this is not get block hashes request? In protocol 60 if geth asks you for hashes and you return less than 512 (and still sees more available), it will drop you. Another reason might be if you advertise availability for some blocks, but don't return them when asked for. Are you sure none of these are the case?
AFAIK, geth will never request 100 blocks, only multiples of 2, so that's another weird thing in your logs.
Aaaah... sorryy.... you are sending the get blocks to geth, and geth is dropping you. Then it's something else.
Do you have a runnable code I could try locally?

@karalabe : sorry I lost you, we can try what every you 
want just let me know
@karalabe I'm on it.

I reproduced this locally with https://github.com/ethereum/ethereumj/commit/3e784f1cdeb302c4924e2c84d381d590b4e8b2b8.

geth says that your get blocks message contains invalid RLP. We're not sending
a useful disconnect reason, but that's why the peer is disconnected.
@romanman Please verify that you are sending 32 bytes of hash data.

```
I0728 19:20:32.397415    3244 handler.go:211] Peer 0d69d21b93345204 [eth/60]: message handling failed: Invalid message - msg msg #5 (69 bytes): rlp: input string too short for common.Hash
I0728 19:20:32.397435    3244 handler.go:135] Removing peer 0d69d21b93345204
I0728 19:20:32.397441    3244 downloader.go:225] Unregistering peer 0d69d21b93345204
I0728 19:20:32.397448    3244 peer.go:305] Peer 0d69d21b93345204 127.0.0.1:44081: Protocol eth/60 error: Invalid message - msg msg #5 (69 bytes): rlp: input string too short for common.Hash
I0728 19:20:32.397464    3244 peer.go:177] Peer 0d69d21b93345204 127.0.0.1:44081: locally requested disconnect: Useless peer
```
@fjl : interesting , can you paste it please : the problem message ?

ethereumj reported:

```
19:51:24.317 [sync]  Peer 1ee6508f: added to pool
19:51:24.318 [sync]  Peer 1ee6508f: its chain is better than previously known: 131072 vs 0
19:51:24.332 [sync]  Hashes retrieving initiated
19:51:24.341 [net]  To:     localhost.localdomain/127.0.0.1:9999     Send:     [GET_BLOCK_HASHES bestHash=fd4af92a79c7fc2fd8bf0d342f2e832e1d4f485c85b9152d2039e03bc604fdca maxBlocks=10000]
19:51:24.348 [net]  From:     localhost.localdomain/127.0.0.1:9999     Recv:     [BLOCK_HASHES[]] (0)
19:51:24.348 [sync]  Block hashes sync completed: 1 hashes in queue
19:51:25.902 [net]  To:     localhost.localdomain/127.0.0.1:9999     Send:     [PING]
19:51:25.906 [net]  From:     localhost.localdomain/127.0.0.1:9999     Recv:     [PONG]
19:51:26.316 [sync]  Blocks retrieving initiated
19:51:26.322 [net]  To:     localhost.localdomain/127.0.0.1:9999     Send:     [GET_BLOCKS fd4af92a79c7fc2fd8bf0d342f2e832e1d4f485c85b9152d2039e03bc604fdca...fd4af92a79c7fc2fd8bf0d342f2e832e1d4f485c85b9152d2039e03bc604fdca] (2)
19:51:26.326 [net]  From:     localhost.localdomain/127.0.0.1:9999     Recv:     [DISCONNECT reason=USELESS_PEER]
```

geth received the following payload for the GET_BLOCKS message:

```
f84305a0fd4af92a79c7fc2fd8bf0d342f2e832e1d4f485c85b9152d2039e03bc604fdcaa0fd4af92a79c7fc2fd8bf0d342f2e832e1d4f485c85b9152d2039e03bc604fdca
```

which has the following structure:

```
[
  05,
  fd4af92a79c7fc2fd8bf0d342f2e832e1d4f485c85b9152d2039e03bc604fdca,
  fd4af92a79c7fc2fd8bf0d342f2e832e1d4f485c85b9152d2039e03bc604fdca,
]
```
@fjl : thanks will check it

@fjl : got it , the message id really moved to RLPx frame so it 
should not be here , strange how cpp was replying to me :)
You might want to check the other messages for such issues, too.
@fjl sure, they are good :+1:

@fjl : `GetTransactionsMessage` used to be like rlp = `C116`
what is it now ?
needs fix: https://github.com/ethereum/ethereumj/blob/30f35ce4348f22aa1632cc4c5684a69c43303c4e/ethereumj-core/src/main/java/org/ethereum/net/eth/TransactionsMessage.java#L53

```
C:\WorkingArea\ethereumj\ethereumj-core\src\main\java\org\ethereum\net\eth\BlocksMessage.java
C:\WorkingArea\ethereumj\ethereumj-core\src\main\java\org\ethereum\net\eth\GetBlocksMessage.java
C:\WorkingArea\ethereumj\ethereumj-core\src\main\java\org\ethereum\net\eth\GetTransactionsMessage.java
C:\WorkingArea\ethereumj\ethereumj-core\src\main\java\org\ethereum\net\eth\TransactionsMessage.java
```
fixed them 10x
@fjl : get_transactions is just rlp = `c0` , right ?
get_transactions is not handled by anyone. you should remove it.
@fjl : ok , thanks

The message code that was get_transactions is now called "new block hashes". 
You can read the spec [here](https://github.com/ethereum/wiki/wiki/Ethereum-Wire-Protocol#ethereum-sub-protocol).
